result.execSummary:
The defendant Edgar Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

BTC: Matter is adjourned.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits. Motion to withdraw is granted.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Edgar Sanchez
Current: 1828 S 19th St, dob: 05-07-1971, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 09-15-2015)

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Do not drive at all.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Edgar Sanchez in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Edgar Sanchez in custody.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Interpreter:  Alberto Aguilar.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
